images.caption: Figure 2:An example of Length Bias Phenomenon Collected from ChartQA. The response is generated by the model after 2-epoch diffusion tuning. The red and blue boxes on the left indicate the source locations of the numbers in the response.
Table S4:Example of Dimple Generation. The image and question are collected from the MMVet dataset[39]. This example demonstrates Dimple’s capabilities in OCR and mathematical reasoning.
Table S5:Example of Dimple Generation. The image and question are collected from the MMVet dataset[39]. This example demonstrates Dimple’s capabilities in pure OCR.
Table S6:Example of Dimple Generation. The image and question are collected from the MMVet dataset[39]. This example demonstrates Dimple’s capabilities in counting.
Table S7:Example of Dimple Generation. The image and question are collected from the MMVet dataset[39]. This example demonstrates Dimple’s capabilities in OCR and chart understanding.
Table S8:Example of Dimple Generation. The image and question are collected from the MMVet dataset[39]. This example demonstrates Dimple’s capabilities in recognition.

Table S9:Example of Dimple Generation. The image and question are collected from the LLaVA Paper[21]. This is a typical example demonstrates the model’s ability to understand memes and the abstract humor embedded within them.
